alert.note: Alert for Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 04 at 9:30PM CDT until May 05 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR WESTERN ZAVALA COUNTY... At 929 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles north of Cometa, or 11 miles northwest of Crystal City, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public reported Tennis ball sized hail at 9:15 PM in western Zavala County. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... La Pryor, Cometa and Las Colonias. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
